Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Employee The Best”
Reviews.Author: Carol D
Reviews.Content: I was never treated so well as I was by the front desk employee by the name of Tina. She took care of a guest's needs and concerns like I've never seen before and went way beyond her call of duty. Also, the shuttle services that were provided by the hotel were top notch and the drivers were so very kind and helpful. Also, the complimentary breakfast bar was so appreciated and the food was very good. The rooms and beds were very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel especially to those who are using the Johns Hopkins Hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfection”
Reviews.Author: ChuccD
Reviews.Content: Although the area isn't the best, this hotel was. Very clean and for the most part the staff was very helpful. Tina in particular was on top of her job. Latisha was very nice as well. The room view was great and the hotel is a short walk to downtown. Maybe 5 minutes away. The reason I can't give a perfect review for service is Samantha, Samantha, and did I mention Samantha? Horrible....HORRIBLE customer service. She never took off her Ipod at any time while helping me and seemed to be outside more than at the desk. She also talked to guests while eating which was rather repulsing. She spoke very ignorantly to some of the other guests and to me about some of the other guests being annoying or stupid and how much she couldn't stand them. Totally inappropriate. If I were her manager, I would fire her immediately. The WORST customer service I have ever experienced in my life. The other employees were so great and did such a good job that it made how she acted all the more noticeable. Overall great service....but they have do something about the bad apple they have before she rubs off on the other good employees

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jordan312
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times while in Baltimore for medical appointments at John Hopkins Hospital. The hotel is close by both the hospital and the inner harbor. We have never walked anywhere from this hotel nor probably never would. However, the hotel has a free shuttle service to the hospital and the inner harbor area including Whole Foods. We have used the shuttle many times and find it to be very convenient as parking rates are very high in the city. The staff has always been very pleasant and the breakfast in adequate. Our room has always been very clean and comfortable. There is a parking fee at this hotel but it is very reasonable compared to other hotels in the city. If the lot is full, there is always free parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: beth c
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location, everything is within a mile and they have a free shuttle. Latisha checked us in and she was so nice and really went the extra mile everytime we asked her a question. David was AMAZING!!!! I rate him a 10 on everything, he was a wonderful shuttle driver and someone nice to talk to at the end of a long night when he was working the late shift. He definetly went above and beyond and made us feel right at home. The hotel was very clean and the housekeepers really did a wonderul job on stayovers. The bad: Samantha- normally I wouldnt speak bad about people but she is not fit for the hotel buisness, or the buisness of working with people in general. Not only would she keep her headphone in her ears the entire time she was talking with any guest, she also bad mouthed guests to us. Every single time we spoke to her she was talking about another guest and was very rude. One time I asked her a question and she said 'Yea Hold on' finished her texting then got up and got me what I asked for. 90 % of the time she was either on the phone or outside.

Reviews.Title: “where you are an inconvenience and pls don't bring your car”
Reviews.Author: theAdog56
Reviews.Content: i am a HI platinum PC member, and a business traveller. I couldn't tell that by my reception on late evening in early April here. No parking spots -you'll have to park it on the street, and get up to move it (where please?) in the morning. And, oh please don't talk so loud when i am mistreatng you at check in- so i walked out . Warning to business travellers-they have limited parking-don't care if there's no space for you, and basically cater to one shot tourists visiting. Not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a dicey neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PAMan804
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel, a nice refurb of a solid building. I have stayed here a few times and feel OK walking from this hotel to the Inner Harbor or Fells Point with the sun up, but not after sundown. The rooms are nice, and pretty quiet in spite of being in a city. Nice hot shower. Sadly the lobby coffee was cold in the afternoon and early morning put my in-room microwave to work. The cream for the coffee was sour, so I had to toss my cup and start over.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, would stay again but on the other side of the building”
Reviews.Author: ager01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, well kept but is too close to the elevated highway and the rooms may be too noisy at times. The lobby is pretty impressive, the staff at the front desk are very nice and helpful. The Inner Harbor and Fells Point are 1 and 1.5 miles away respectively and make for a nice walk. I will definitely stay here again but will request a room on the opposite side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Could've Been a "5"...”
Reviews.Author: OCsandy
Reviews.Content: After some soul-searching, I decided to give this particular hotel a "3". Here's why: First: Do not, I repeat, DO NOT get either of the two rooms that are directly above the lobby. The high ceiling and marble walls of the lobby create such a din inside your room that it sounds like you're sitting around an indoor pool. At one point in the afternoon, it was so loud that I had to check to see who was making all the noise. Unbelievably, it was only the desk clerk checking in ONE customer. The echo in the lobby (and into the room) made it sound like 20 people. I am not kidding. Then, around 11PM, a youth group of about 30 were in the lobby. You could not even hear the TV in my room during their (lengthy) check-in. Secondly: Parking is always a problem, especially downtown, which I certainly understand. Since I knew was getting back to the hotel very late, I asked what the options were if the lot was full. I was told that "there are 28 spots, and we only give out 28 parking passes, so you should have no problem." Of course, that NEVER works, and I needed to park on the street when I came in late. No problem... it's happened to me many times at many downtown hotels. But here's the problem: When I went to the desk in the morning to request the parking fee be charged-off on the account (because it was full), I was given somewhat of a 'lecture' to the effect that I should've immediately "reported it" to the desk upon my return to the hotel. I responded that "that particular rule was not addressed" when I checked-in. (Had to give a little bit of 'tude back to the agent!) Anyway... It was charged-off, but I remember the 'lecture' more than the courtesy they gave me by not charging me. Without the little bit of attitude on the parking, I would've probably given the hotel a 5. If they would've mentioned that the room they had assigned me was very (no, make that "incredibly") loud, again I would've given them a 5. I really feel that they should make it a policy to mention that fact before they assign the room. (As a side note: At many hotels where I stay that have a nightclub in the hotel, I offer to take the rooms closest to the club, because working nights, I'm out of the hotel before the music starts, and come back in after the club is closed. I do this as somewhat of a courtesy to the hotel, because I'm sure the noisy room is hard to sell. Too bad this hotel didn't give me the same courtesy. Everything else was fine... Spotlessly clean... HUGE rooms... Close to downtown and many attractions. I should also say that when I mentioned the noise in the room to the desk clerk, he quickly offered to move us into another room, but we were already settled-in and unpacked, and thought the noise would subside a bit. We should've taken him up on the offer. One more thing - the lobby, which was obviously once an old bank building, as noisy as it was, was absolutely beautiful. Wait 'til you see it. Very impressive. I'll stay there again... But certainly not in that same room!

Reviews.Title: “Baseball, Bachelorette, Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Classic4
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have stayed at this hotel twice, both during summer trips to see Redsox vs. Orioles series. The rooms are comfortable and clean, breakfast is hot and good enough, parking is convenient and safe, staff is polite and accommodating, we stayed there twice... ! The location seems a little sketchy, across from police/court station? But my friend smokes so we spent plenty of time outside on the stairs and waiting for cabs and were not unsafe. Most days we chose to walk to the waterfront, restaurants, shops, and Power Plant. It wasn't too far, but it was too hot! and the sections you walk through are a little unsettling, but mind you we did it two years in a row so it obviously wasn't bad at all. Cabs are available and cheap, and necessary to go to the stadium. There is another Holiday Inn downtown that has a pool, we asked to use it but they are individually owned and would not let us... something to think about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in sketchy neighborhood - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: NJDebster
Reviews.Content: I just had surgery at John Hopkins and we decided to stay at this hotel before and afterwards. The hotel is built in an old bank so the lobby is beautiful. The room we had was a very nice hotel room - no maintenance issues and nicely decorated. Beds were good to sleep on and the shower pressure was okay. Bad in the mornings though. We had a microwave, fridge, and complimentary internet. I stayed there the first night and the last two nights. My husband stayed the entire time. We got the patient rate from Johns Hopkins. If you are there for the hospitals, check with their guest services staff as they can help with this hotel and others in the area. This hotel was about 10 minutes from the hospital parking garage. They also charged lower parking fees than other downtown Baltimore hotels (more on that below). They run a complimentary shuttle for going back and forth to the hospital and other nearby areas. My husband enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning - especially the pancake maker. Said the variety of items was very good. I wasn't really up to eating much. I will say how much I appreciated the staff. The young woman at the desk went out of her way to help us with hospital planning and our car arrangements. She helped us with directions to the local drug store for stuff I needed and to other shopping. I think her name was Samantha - she was a dynamo. The downside for this hotel was the neighborhood was definitely inner city. Not much close by and many of the guests were using the shuttle to other areas. The shuttle was popular. Also, we were warned to clear everything out of our car as the lot next to the hotel was a target for local crime. The parking lot has limited spaces. They try to control this by only accepting enough cars for their 28 spaces but you know how people can be taking up extra spaces. Something to check on - you may not get a parking space. HINT: Go park in Johns Hopkins outpatient center lot (a few blocks over) and have the shuttle take you back and forth. If you get the discount tickets, the cost is $5 for parking 24 hours and their deck is more secure. You just have to wait for the shuttle or take a cab. I would definitely stay here again if I have to return to Johns Hopkins. I would also stay if I was on business or if I was inner city comfortable and wanted to see Baltimore. Just be aware of safety - this is a city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelRater2012
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on Hotwire. Had to pay $10 more to upgrade to two double beds. Rooms were clean and spacious. Internet was free. The only thing is you have to pay for parking but parking is cheaper here compared to places downtown. Combined with the free shuttle option to places like the aquarium, this place is a great place to stay for sightseeing in downtown Baltimore. On top of that, they offer complimentary breakfast, that is not that great but still is an added plus!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for family with teenagers and pets”
Reviews.Author: Marisela74
Reviews.Content: I stayed because I bought tickets to attend a new year's concert at Baltimore Sound Stage. After spending so many hours of research this was the closest hotel to the concert walking distance. The price was affordable for a family mini-vacation. The hotel is pet friendly, the cost for a pet is $50 per stay not per night. The only complain that I have is that the head board of the beds were dusty. I am a clean freak and I can say that I know for a fact they do not clean the top of bed head boards, top of pictures frames, and top of mirrors. The bathroom was nicely clean, except the bathroom curtain needs to be replaced. Everything else was excellent. The room was extremely clean except for the minors details that I just mentioned. The staff were very nice and friendly; Samantha was the front desk receptionist that welcomed us. Yadira, the lady responsible for the breakfast was also very nice and always made sure everything was clean. The hotel is great I will stay there again but the location is awful for someone that is not used seeing homeless and people stopping begging for money. Even at the port there were people following asking for money. This was very uncomfortable because I did not feel safe walking outside the Gallery. If you are a New Yorker you would not mine walking 10 minutes to reach Inner Harbor. The parking was $12 per night. My husband was walking our dog around midnight and was stopped by the cops and the officer asked him rudely if he was drunk. The police was not friendly at all. Make sure you bring water since the hotel only has vender machines and does not offer free bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for basic needs”
Reviews.Author: rodyk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2001 on a business trip. My needs are few, I just wanted to be fairly close to the offices I wa visiting, and this hotel suited my needs just fine. I wouldn't stay here as a tourist, just since it's really a little beyond walking distance to the inner harbor hot spots. It has a tiny paking lot for $12/night, isn't really in a great neighborhood, and has no restaurant besides the breakfast nook. Otherwise, it's a steal compared to other hotels closer to the inner harbor. My room was very clean, the free internet was fast, and there's plenty of take-out/eat-in restaurants in the area. The lobby is suprisingly spacious for a small hotel, no doubt because it was a former bank. There are offices even built into the old vault behind the reception desk. Check-in and out was super-fast. The flat-screen TV, refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave were all in perfect working order. For business, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old, unsafe area”
Reviews.Author: Segalini09
Reviews.Content: I checked in late and the front desk was very accomodating, offering me a shuttle to the local restaraunt area. That is where it ended. The room was older, worn looking. The tub had huge black hairs on the curtains. Parking was poor. There was no room in the tiny lot so I had to park in the alley near the hotel. I was going to walk the 4 blocks back from the restaraunt, but felt unsafe, so took a 4 block cab ride, since shuttle service ended at 9:30. The hotel was ok, the staff was ok, but the area is TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MK_P2123
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this property. On arriving at the hotel, I must admit that from the outside it looked like a very basic property & I was prepared to accept that I would be staying in just an average hotel. When I entered the lobby, my whole impression of the place started to change. The lobby is beautiful and very welcoming. The hotel employees were very courteous & helpful for my entire stay. Having a courtesy shuttle was extremely convenient, and the breakfast every morning was more than adequate. As a travel agent, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, location a little sketchy, don't leave laundry in!!”
Reviews.Author: fernga
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year for a wedding. The hotel is nice as were the staff. Location is a little off the beaten track with a juvenile detention centre across the way, but we had no hassle. We had a major issue with dry cleaning, a dress shirt we left in was ruined and we were promised compensation for this. One year on and countless e-mails later, still no joy. the hotle should take more ownership of their suppliers and not make promises they cannot keep as we have wasted so much energy on this. I would not go back or recommend this hotel based on this experience which is a pity as I am a frequent traveller to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value in downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: STH2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2011 while visiting a prospective school with my daughter. Very close to Baltimore Penn Station and the inner harbor. It's in an old, historical building, with refurbished interior and modernized rooms. Free shuttle within 3 miles made it a very convenient hotel; driver was friendly and polite. Typical decent Holiday Inn Express breakfast (cereals, fruits, pancakes, eggs, coffee, juices, etc.) which makes this a value for money hotel. Rooms were clean, bathrooms had high vanities with granite tops. Towels surprisingly un-luxurious - in fact, thin and one was a little worn looking - but otherwise, the bath experience is fine with strong shower, and the usual shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap amenities. The room also had a small ref, and a microwave - not typical in other Holiday Inn Express hotels I've stayed in. The main downside seems to be Baltimore's typical safety and security issues: one long term hotel resident advised me while we were on our way to the ice machine, to not leave anything in the car when parking in the hotel car park, as 2 residents had their cars broken into within the last few weeks. Fortunately, we didn't bring a vehicle with us at that time. We checked in on Sunday evening - at that time, customer service was somewhat spotty as it took some time and 2 calls for the staff to attend to my request for an ethernet line to be provided in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Not located in a 'rough', not paticularly safe or kids friendly area!!”
Reviews.Author: himmat20
Reviews.Content: We went to Balitimore for our daughter's treatment at Johns Hopkins. Wanted a peaceful stay as we have more important issues to deal with. We came to the hotel on a Sunday evening, the area was deserted, the holtel is located oppossite the Jurvenile Court of Balitimore, with a few not very welcoming people walking around. Lots of cop cars around (is close to a police station too). All in all not a place you would want to bring your kids and family to, a rough neighbourhood. We did NOT Stay at the property and checked out immediately. Ending up spending a lot more $$$$ (walk in pices in the inner harhour area at a lot higher). I wrote in to the manager seeking a refund as we did not stay at the hotel however no response and a nice fat bill for a service that was far below expectation one that we did not consume. This Holiday Inn express is 20-30% cheaper for a reason. But the last thing one wants when you are travelling is the risk of getting into a situation. My advise if you have a family travelling with you, dont be penny wise and pound foolish live within the inner city area. I can deal with a poor quality room or service but safety of my family is paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Takman13
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff and a free breakfast. The hotel was located in a sketchy part of town, but I had no problems. The hotel shuttle was always offered for trips anywhere around town. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCaru
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was medical, an evaluation at Johns Hopkins Hospital. The staff, especially Brad and Samantha, were most helpful. The rooms are clean and nicely appointed. The breakfast is a notch or two above the usual continental breakfasts at such hotels. There is free shuttle service both to downtown and to the hospital. Gracious drivers. This is a very affordable, pleasant experience in a completely redone 1940's bank structure. Interesting lobby with marble pillars and vaulted ceiling. We will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would make reservations here again without a second thought.”
Reviews.Author: PandhandleGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a relative underwent treatment at Johns Hopkins. The room was nice and the bathroom had a large countertop for items when getting ready to go-a small thing but it annoys me to have to try to balance my make-up, etc. on the back of the toilet or tiny countertop. The staff was friendly and professional and they offered the best hospital rate I found. The only downside was being from out of state, I was dependent on public transportation or the hotel shuttle. The shuttle was often in the 20/30 minute "late" time frame they made clear in the instructions due to traffic, etc. However, that is beyond their control and the shuttle drivers were all friendly and professional as well. I heard from some that the neighborhood was less than desirable, but I give them kudos for turning that beautiful old bank building into a beautiful, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above average for the chain”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: Based on a one night last minute overnight in Baltimore, this HI Express met and exceeded my needs and expectations-- I choose it because it was close to my meeting. The lobby is very nice (a converted bank building) with pleasant and friendly front desk people who checked me in quickly. My room was large, nicely decorated, and well equipped. The bed was comfortable and sleep interrupted a bit by noise outside-- expected, it is a city. The whole experience was more of a Hyatt or Marriott type experience than a Holiday Inn. The only negative was breakfast which was exactly what I would expect for this grade of hotel-- pre-packaged "omelets" with artificial appearing eggs and processed cheese, pancakes made from a rather odd contraption that spit them out like it was a printing press, and danish. It would have been nice to have some heart smart options, for instance a selection of cereals and even oatmeal. It's a fairly close walk to the Inner Harbor, but not on the Harbor-- but also not with the higher prices of the Inner Harbor. I would stay there again, however, on a similar type trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting Inner Harbor and Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: R N
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty decent property. The only reason I didnt give it a better rating was there was no internet available in my room (jacuzzi suite on the ground/basement level). The carpet in the room was stained, I would imagine due to the jacuzzi overflowing at times, and the room was some musty, again, probably due to the damp carpet. The staff were all very nice. And the overall property is very nice and clean. I would stay here again, but I would inspect the room before I move in all my luggage. Breakfast was the standard contential fare, with some hot items (processed eggs, biscuits and gravy etc). Overall all pretty good for the money (free).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Express”
Reviews.Author: gplace77
Reviews.Content: This is a city hotel with huge rooms and a great price. Shuttle service, which departs on the hour, was fantastic and brought us to Fell's Point and Camden Yards and offered to pick us up at reasonable times. Both drivers were awesome and drove responsibly; we declined the pickup and preferred to walk back. The sheets were clean, the showers were nice, and the breakfast bar had hot food. Every person that worked at this hotel was polite, conversational, and would go out of their way to make sure our needs were accommodated. Being an old bank building I could not get wi-fi in the basement floor where the suites are and that might be my only complaint. It's less than a mile to the aquarium and a little over a mile to Camden yards and both directions seemed safe for foot traffic till after dusk, just don't walk north past the police station after dark but there is nothing of interest in that direction anyway. You need to know that outside of the inner harbor and university center everything looks like homeless town in this city but cabs are a decent alternative to walking if it's after shuttle hours and if you look around you can find a Prius cab and go green. Domino's delivers to this hotel until 2 am. #winning

Reviews.Title: “If it wasn't for the parking situation.....”
Reviews.Author: Amesk
Reviews.Content: I would have liked this place SO much more. The parking is awful. A tiny little lot, at the time, surrounded by construction, so you park on the street. The hotel itself was nice, the lobby was fabulous, being an old restored bank. The rooms are rooms. Nothing spectacular, nothing hateful. We didn't do any research first (bad, bad) and did not look up any nearby dining. The neighborhood is kind of shady, and we were tired, so we didn't go exploring. Dinner came out of the vendos, which made me sad and cranky, but not sad and cranky enough to want to lose the parking space we had circled the block twice to get. We will stay here again this October, the price is right, and the place is nice. And I'm sure we will park on the street. Again. But no more vendo dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room...no parking”
Reviews.Author: Blkcat13
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 1:00am and there was no parking. We had to wait a bit for someone to show up at the front desk and when he did he said we could park on the street. Not gonna happen in downtown Baltimore. We showed him two spots in the back next to the hotel and he said they were ok. Early the next morning we were threaten with being towed as apparently these spots belong to the garage next door. The room was nice but quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hanknlori
Reviews.Content: The most helpful thing about this hotel is that they offer a free shuttle service to Johns Hopkins and the train station. But really they will take to anywhere within a mile of the hotel. The neighborhood is a little on the edge but we had no trouble. We walked downtown and to the waterfront from there. The free breakfasts were good, a hot meal! Over all a very nice place to stay with staff very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a business trip.”
Reviews.Author: clh6262
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and quiet. The lobby is beautiful and the breakfast is acceptable (but get there early or there's nowhere to sit.) The only thing that bothered me was the parking and the television system. There is a parking lot out back - which is great - but it fills up quickly and you need a pass. Even if you pay for the pass, there's no guarantee that someone won't take your space. Anyway - I would probably stay there again. It is very conveniently located near the I-83 and I generally like this brand for business travel. If you are not familiar with Baltimore, definitely use their shuttle or a cab or become very acquainted with a map because it can get confusing to drive around that area of the city - especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jackkennady
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, Brittany, our hospitality advisor, was extremely kind, friendly, and amiable. The old bank that they turned into this hotel is beautiful with a large lobby and marble everywhere. The shuttle service was fantastic, the drivers very good and friendly. The room was bigger than expected (we booked a 2 queens room for 4 of us) and the beds were comfortable while the room smelled like flowers when you walked in. I'd advise this hotel to anyone, enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Car window smashed”
Reviews.Author: Sechr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my 8 year old for an appt the following day at Johns Hopkins. There was no parking. I did find an empty spot in the lot, but was I couldn't park there because all the permits were taken. The clerk suggested I park on the street. I was hesitant, but he assured me it would be fine. Imagine our surprise when we came out in the morning to a smashed window. Nothing was taken because I didn't leave anything, but we were an hour late for our appointment and the hotel refused to pay for the window. They refunded our room, but it was being paid for by a study we were in anyway. Now we are out almost $300 to fix our window. The hotel manager, Mark, would not help us other than giving us a refund on our room. I would definitely not recommend staying there. This is a huge inconvenience to us because we have to get the window fixed and obviously, financially it's not fun either. My 8 year old is now very anxious for her appointment as well, because of this mornings happenings.

Reviews.Title: “Very courteous staff and great for the value for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: parksters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight and enjoyed our stay for an affordable hotel within the city limits. Although this hotel isn't situated inner harbor their complimentary shuttle made it easily accessible. Driver was very polite and ontime for pickup. Hotel parking was tight during the weekend, but there was plenty of street parking that was cheaper. Hotel is newly renovated. Buffet was the normal HI smart breakfast and was up to our standards, but you'll need to get their early since they have one person restocking the food. The folks at the front desk were very friendly and polite. There's no swimming pool and maybe that's why it's a little cheaper than the other Holiday Inn across town. One last note, there are two ways to walk to Inner Harbor. There's the Gay street way which is not the recommended way because you'll have to walk under the bridge pass the bars and strip clubs (not a family friendly scene) OR there's the President street way which is perfectly safe. In fact, it's close to Port Discovery and Little Italy so it's actually a pretty good location.

Reviews.Title: “Like a small boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VTMOM2002
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for a couple of days recently. It is in an old historic Bank, the lobby and room (on the 5th floor) was beautiful, clean and well kept but what made the stay exceptional was the staff from Brittany the hospitality manager who ran the free breakfast (eggs, bacon, pancakes etc) to Brady, Jeremy, Leticia at the front desk, Brady who gave a historical tour as he drove the shuttle and Dale who sang while driving the free shuttle to everything and the smiling housekeepers they made you feel extremely welcome and catered to your every need. Though the hotel does not have a pool much to my daughter's disappointment, she ended up being charmed by the staff and asked to come back again. There are not many hotels where I would remember the names of so many staff members but this hotel made an impression. I would highly recommend this Holiday Inn Express to friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: woffer
Reviews.Content: Although location is slightly out of the way, the service made up for it. Nice hotel. Clean. Good service. Right price. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service, They accomodate the location”
Reviews.Author: dsterbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the weekend while sightseeing. We were a little dissapointed that there are no attractions to see without taking the shuttle or walking a minimum of 1/2 mile. However, they accomodated us very well with the shuttle and it was a nice clean hotel. I would like to especially mention the very friendly and always smiling Brittany, who sets up the free breakfast every morning and started off all three days for us with some great hospitality and genuine happiness.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place you can BANK on...”
Reviews.Author: mdkadk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times when coming in for Yankee games. The staff have always been helpful, and getting their limited parking is a deal for a few days in town. Renovated from a former Bank, it won't break yours! Last stay they got a room ready for us early as we arrived earlier than expected and took care of us promptly. We understand the area, but have never had a problem at night when coming back from the inner harbor - just stay on the main streets. Always clean and well appointed rooms are nice, and they do a great job on the free HIE breakfast. Not the closest room to the Inner Harbor or the Yard, but a good stop!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: deonyx
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. The hotel lobby and appearance were nice. Staff was fine. The room was small but nice but the CARPET in our room was FILTHY. Huge black spots in covered the small space. That made me question the cleanliness of everything else. The carpet in that room needs to be replaced!

Reviews.Title: “Restored Building”
Reviews.Author: jmedster
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not in the best neighborhood but not bad. The building is an old bank and the lobby is grand! The hotel is clean and the staff is wonderful. You could walk to the Inner Harbor but you go past a street of strip clubs. The hotel has a free shuttle and they are very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “easy friendly functional”
Reviews.Author: retiree4637
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed 5 nights. good price for near the harbor. They provided great transport to all harbor sights. Easy to use parking for rental car which we needed for family and friends connecting. Especially friendly and interested in us, and made helpful suggestions. Would stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed, awesome value”
Reviews.Author: rhialistic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights this past May and were pleasantly surprised with the comfort of the rooms as well as the friendly service. It is not far from the Harbor, but still a bit of a walk, so perhaps that is why this hotel was reasonably priced. If you want to get to the harbor, you can walk, or take the free hotel shuttle. In addition there are convenient bus and subway routes to get you around without a car. We would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was OK”
Reviews.Author: jmharris5
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was OK, room was clean and modern, lobby (was a bank) is impressive, limited parking, breakfast was good. Not the safest area to stay, better off closer to the harbor. Staff was good. They refused to give me the 1000 bonus points as advertised when I booked the room, I am not happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “pillows were more lumpy than my homemade gravy”
Reviews.Author: mimi_linna
Reviews.Content: We went to Baltimore for a convention at the inner harbor and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express because it was reasonably priced. The hotel is a old 1923 bank building..beautifully redone. We stayed in room 406. Very clean and the bed was comfortable..but the pillows were so lumpy, I could not sleep on them.. so I called the front desk at 9ish pm.. to ask for another pillow..was told that housekeeping was locked for the night.. really?? you run a hotel and guests can't get a non lumpy pillow.. ended up using the blanket at the end of the bed, folding it up and putting a pillow case on it. The next day I called and got another lumpy pillow.. but finally/ a new pillow was delivered. They would have wowed me if they had brought 4 brand new pillows..but one did the trick and I was able to sleep. Another guest also told us that he had lumpy pillows room 411.. so if you stay here..check out your pillows when you arrive and get someone on it. I did not feel comfortable walking in the neighborhood and took a cab everywhere. Down the street from the homeless mission and adult video store. If you are going for medical reasons, it is very close to the hospitals. I felt safe inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean amenities!”
Reviews.Author: yankee42161
Reviews.Content: * Awesome restored historic lobby! * Great continental + breakfast! * Super friendly & accomodating staff! * Quiet, clean & spacious rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Truly Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SuperTraveler198527
Reviews.Content: The team at the Holiday Inn Express Dwntwn was great! My check in was fast and correct, the room was super clean and I will definitely stay at this location on future travel to Baltimore. The location is nice, breakfast was hot and it is close to a major freeway. Certain rooms have trouble with WIFI, however the staff assisted with this issue and resolved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: wichmana
Reviews.Content: Whenver I am in the Baltimore area I stay at this hotel, for several reasons. You get consistent great quality with a free, HOT breakfast, fitness center (WITH WORKING EQUIPMENT, ) and FREE wifi in rooms. The staff is so kind and friendly, really goes out of their way to be hospitable. I love that every Wednesday they do a managers reception with free appetizers and drinks. Perfect for the business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and service- would not hestitate to book with them again.”
Reviews.Author: mezaveronica
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 2 different occasions. It is immaculately clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk service; beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: cottage95
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fourth floor with our two sons and were so pleased for the price. We booked through hotwire.com and paid just over $100/night for a large, modern room with two comfortable queen beds. The bathroom was clean and had a great shower. The front desk staff was super-helpful and professional, and the shuttle driver was also personable and accommodating. We were able to walk to Little Italy and the Convention Center easily enough (15 minutes). There was some highway noise, but not a problem for the average sleeper. There isn't much to do in the immediate area surrounding the hotel, but for the price, we were very satisfied. Highly recommend for those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance, great location”
Reviews.Author: compost4all
Reviews.Content: Formerly a classic, elegant bank, the hotel offers good access to downtown Baltimore, not far from Little Italy. Great bathroom, comfy beds, free internet. The hotel works with Johns Hopkins for special rates and a free shuttle bus to the hospital. Also to local restaurants. Breakfast is average. Front desk tries to be helpful and are very cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for $. Convenient. Staff very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: ginger1987_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last month. Originally I was concerned after reading the reviews of the area and parking lot. My daughter and I were traveling alone. The area looked a little seedy, but we did not feel unsafe at all. We used the shuttle to the Inner Harbor and drove to Johns Hopkins. The location was very convenient to both places. The rooms were very nice, roomy, clean and quiet. The breakfast was very good. There was a full breakfast with eggs, bacon, cereal, sweet rolls, yogurt etc. Coffee available all day. The staff was extremely helpful with all of our questions. I was aware of the $12 parking fee and knew that it was not added into my quoted price. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel of last choice”
Reviews.Author: irloyal
Reviews.Content: I would look elsewhere first. HOWEVER, if you can't find what you desire in the way of value and location this is a pretty decent hotel. Good - Unique building. It is a remodeled bank building so it is pretty unique architecture. The rooms are very nice and clean, although maybe a bit cramped. No more than two to a room. The breakfast is adequate, the service very good and the staff is friendly. A microwave and refrigerator are nice additions. Bad - Location is HORRIBLE. Very little parking and it is marginally secured. The neighborhood is pretty questionable, I would not venture out at night - PERIOD. There are no restaurants or services within 2 or 3 blocks. Also when I got up the next morning, I noticed that my room door would open without a key, just a sharp push on the door and it spung open. The door frame looked like it had been forced before and the lock was NOT secure. If you can't find something else, this place is very nice, but it is not on my "return to" list

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel with great staff and amenities”
Reviews.Author: oldnovice
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th visit to Baltimore for medical concerns at Johns Hopkins. The hotel is charming...not too big...not too small...the staff are totally responsive. The rooms are very nice. The linens are all new and the rooms have the appearance of care by the cleaning staff. I think that corporate staff should visit this HI Express to see how it SHOULD be done!! Frankly I don't know why anyone would stay at the old style HI hotels anymore. Yeah, so this hotel is not in the greatest part of town...true BUT the van service is superior and available during most of the day. The proximity to Johns Hopkins and the Old Harbor are terrific. I could go on...the owner of this site gets big kudos from us.

Reviews.Title: “Unique building and everything well thought out”
Reviews.Author: PaulAtkin
Reviews.Content: Great former bank building. Friendly helpful staff and everything thought of: good breakfast, free PCs available for internet access. A short walk to the Harbor area and much better value!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Downtown and Free Breakfast how can you beat that”
Reviews.Author: TrickyTravler
Reviews.Content: Nice building, as all the other reviews have stated it's bulit into an old bank, the reception was very nice, nice beds and excellent breakfast very close to the infamous Burbon Street, easy cab ride to Fells Point, Inner Harbor and Mount Veron , Would love to go back if i ever get the opportunity

Reviews.Title: “Unique Holiday Inn Express In Downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Redsox1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built into an old bank, located near the downtown area and a short cab ride to the water. Rooms were that of a new HIE, Fresh and Clean. Reception desk was very good. Good free breakfast

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: nallers
Reviews.Content: the whole hotel was very clean . the rom was very nice ,very spacious. sleep was interuppted by people on the weekend coming in friday and saturday night. only thing i was not happy with was the heat. . the manager of the front desk looked at it but could not fix it. so n one cameto fix it. my trip was very good. nice placeto be when gongto John Hopkins not to far away. SHuttle service was a real help. I would go back there I have all ready made a reservation to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JameeD
Reviews.Content: The room was really nice and we had a nice view of the city. It was kind of neat to see the old vaults that were used when this place was a bank. The hotel was clean and the service was great. The free shuttle that ran down to the inner harbor was so nice and convenient. We had a nice view of the city. The free internet in each room was also a plus! I was very happy with the hotel. The only pitfall was that the fitness center was small and the treadmill was not working properly. Howvever, there is a bike and elliptical machine as well. And there is a parking fee of $12.00 for parking in their parking lot overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Inside, Seedy Outside”
Reviews.Author: BuenoBonitoBarrato
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous Lobby, Clean Modern Rooms - I've stayed in a Holiday Inn Express in Mexico with great success - clean, basic, inexpensive. And that is what is was - inside. Outside, the environment is run-down with 24-hour porn stores. The hotel is directly across from the Juvenile Justice Center and according to the front desk attendant, right in between 3 (THREE) police stations - so it's safe!!! Not a comfortable environment for a family with young kids. Business, on your own and watching the cash, sure. We had to abandon the reservation. I'll still try a Holiday Inn Express but I will do some more research first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RMinard
Reviews.Content: I got this room from Priceline.com. I was a little hesitant about the hotel at first from reading some reviews about it. First it is a great hotel, it use to be a bank at one point but it was remodeled about a year ago from what the hotel staff told me. The rooms are very clean and the staff could not have been any nicer. I forgot a few items like a razor and shaving cream so the staff gave me them for free. The location in not so great located right off the interstate highway about a mile from the inner harbor. Traveling with a young child I did not want to walk there. The hotel offers a free shuttle anywhere in the city within 1 mile which was great. I did not have to use my own vehicle all weekend nor did I have to pay any parking fees except the $24.00 at the hotel for 2 days. About the parking, they have a small parking lot in which they charge $12.00 a night, but you have to get there early, it is a first come first served parking lot. If you are not lucky enough to park in their lot you will have to pay to park on the street. The street is not too busy and there is a big police presents since there is a police station not too far away. So I believe it is safe to park there. The hotel offers a free breakfast which includes hot items (eggs, sausage, bacon, etc) also juice, milk, fruit, yogurt plus alot more. One down side to the hotel there is no convenience store or pharmacy close by so you will have to pick stuff up before getting to the hotel or venture out on your own in the city. In all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great service, clean room, and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Hans47
Reviews.Content: Old bank remodeled into a interesting little hotel. Rooms were good sized with nice design. Area of town was a little dicey but a shuttle can take you to and pick you up within a mile radius, which would cover the inner harbor. Decent breakfast also.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean hotel for a great price in a...”
Reviews.Author: Jenelph
Reviews.Content: New, clean hotel for a great price in a terrible location. Staff slow and uneager to help with information but will eventually get around to getting you what you need. This is probably due to understaffing. Location of hotel is in a neighborhood with high crime adjacent to a bridge that shelters the homeless. There are few restaurants in the area and too far to walk to inner harbor but, hotel does provide a shuttle. Our car was broken into and window smashed in hotel parking lot that does not contain any security,including cameras, although the police stated that our car was the 10th this month to be broken into in this lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jmo1979
Reviews.Content: If you don't need to be directly on the Inner Harbor, I highly reccommend checking out this hotel. I found it on Hotwire.com at $39 a night, **1/2 stars. It was exactly what I was looking for. Very cute, very clean room! Flat screen tv, big closet, big bathroom, a comfy bed, and quiet. Getting a room from Hotwire usually means you're near the elevator, but even so, the ambient noise from the hall was minimal. Also, my room was directly across from the highway - more or less just white noise, nothing intrusive. The hotel itself is off the beaten path, 1 mile in from the Inner Harbor. The area is a little rundown, but I never felt unsafe - I suspect the gentrification of Baltimore will be there soon. It's near the Hopkins campus and there are A LOT of people walking around during the day, with a constant police presence. I did not go down for the complimentary breakfast (630a-9a), but the all day coffee/tea service was good. There is free WiFi in the room, which is convenient, but the connection is unsecured and a little spotty. All in all though, definitely worth keeping in mind if you are looking for a great place to stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice HI Express!!”
Reviews.Author: 1classydiva
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful with all of my requests. My only concern is the parking lot. There's a God-awful limited amount of parking for the guests. Not everyone will get to pay to park in the small lot. I also felt unsafe with just the lighting. There lot should be monitored via CC circuit. The area is not that great at all. Overall, I would still stay there again simply because of the staff and beautiful rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Has potential, but wasn't ready for prime time.”
Reviews.Author: sight-singer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in a great area, but it is in a beautiful building. The hotel had opened only a month or two before we stayed there. The elevators failed and weren't operable the morning of our departure. The breakfast, which is included, looked pretty good, though we had other plans. Also, at 3AM some young people knocked insistently on our door. They seemed to imply that thought that someone they knew was in the room. Clearly, this demonstrated a security problem. It was very disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and OK location if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: mewzzz
Reviews.Content: I booked this three-night trip through HotWire, and got a really good price. Overall I was very satisfied with the room -- the hotel was super clean, the staff really nice, and it was a real perk to get free breakfast. Maybe it's just continental, but there was a lot of variety -- eggs, several types of bread products including cinnamon buns, cereal, oatmeal, sausage, bacon, biscuits. There were a variety of hot drinks available downstairs all day, too, which was also nice. In terms of service, somethings were a bit disorganized -- I tried to print something out, and they had no idea where it was being printed from. They ended up printing it out for me, and at no cost, so I can't really complain, though. (It was honestly a lot of papers, so I actually really appreciated it.) Though they have a 'shuttle', it's really just a company van, and they can only get you around if the person is there (and available). Thus I got to use the van twice, and had to walk downtown twice. This isn't the hotels fault, really, but the taxi they asked to come back for me didn't come back, and there weren't any around, so I ended up being a bit late for one of my events, too. Which brings me to the question of location. I was a bit concerned when I found out where it was -- it's in the downtown area, but honestly it's a couple of blocks away from the main strip, and you have to walk under the highway to get to it. At morning and during the day this isn't a problem, and I felt very comfortable walking downtown. At night, though, it's pretty dark and relatively isolated. I walked back when it was just seven and felt OK, but the other night I ended up taxing it back, so you might want to keep the taxi money in your budget. It's not expensive, though -- about 5 to 6 dollars to the convention center. However, the really bad thing about the location is that there's no place to eat around it, as far as I could tell. The hotel offers free coffee and drinks downstairs all the time, but there weren't any restaurants nearby, and you'd have to walk a decent bit to even get to a store to sell you something. It's definitely important to get what you want before heading back, though those with cars may not be concerned. Overall, I'd say if you could get a deal like I did, it's definitely worth it and you'll be really satisfied. I got a great price, and am really happy with it. But if I were going to pay 110 dollars, I might choose to be at one of the hotels closer to the harbor which are about the same, just so I don't have to walk around to find food.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe - room doors don't lock. And watch your credit card - I got charged thrice!”
Reviews.Author: alpa10
Reviews.Content: My advice - stay in Motel 6 for half the price, a safer environment and far better customer service. I found this hotel from Priceline for one night - got a great rate and turned out to be a decent first day experience. Then I had to extend my stay by two nights (now at $112 per night regular hotel rates) because there was a huge snowstorm on the East Coast and my flight back home got cancelled. And that's when I saw how bad this hotel was. A couple of hours after I checked into my room I discovered that after I locked the door, it would not lock. (God knows how many people must've stayed in that room with a false sense of security!) And as it turns out, this hotel in within a few hundred yards of a juvenile detention center. Yeah right, now I am going to feel very cozy and safe! When I informed the front desk, they assigned me another room, the keys to which wouldn't open the room. Onward to another room,and the rest of the stay was uneventful. FInally I got back home. A couple of days later I discovered that I was charged for one night more ($112). When I called they said they couldn't find that transaction on their files. After a lot of agony and a lot of phone calls they said they will fix it. They didn't. I called up again and spoke to someone at the front desk who said she didn't have time to look into my file, but will do it later. A week later, instead of reimbursing me $112, they charged my credit another $224. What a circus! I called up again this morning. The person to deal with is still not in. Somehow, they don't care, they don't seem very competent and as a rule they never return your phone callsl All hotels have a manager who should be taking care of things when they get this messy. For this Holiday Inn Express either s/he doesn't exist or is not very interested in providing good customer service. Hello, are you there? If this review gets your attention, please return my money and feel free to call me. And please get a little more involved in how your hotel is being run instead of playing golf all day. By all means stay in this hotel if you feel like it - the rooms were good, but I didn't feel safe at all. Not to mention, that even though I have checked out almost 2 weeks ago and they still keep charging me for my stay there. Get the point? TripAdvisor has a question below this write-up asking me whether I would recommend this hotel to a friend. Too bad they don't have a "Are you kidding me?" option......

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hezheather
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in Baltimore during "blizzard", booked this hotel online due to location (within one mile of Johns Hopkins). What a great hotel! Beautifully decorated, super friendly staff, very comfortable room. Highly recommended! Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Basic Hotel if you Get a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: irlundee
Reviews.Content: New hotel, small rooms but clean and crisp, free wifi, very fast, breakfast included but very basic - don't expect blueberries and eggs how you want them! Getting wifi and breakfast of any sort included with a clean room, climate control - can't go wrong. Very basic hotel, not much going on so if you want a clean room with internet, go for it if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel with an excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: dutchietraveler
Reviews.Content: stayed in oct during a conference. THe hotel is new, and it is truly a good hotel. The rooms are spacious, nice. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the convention centre, perfect. (one day the shuttle wasn`t there and we needed a trip to the convention centre, the staff arranged a taxi, for free. free breakfast, free internet acces, the fitness centre is the only thing that could have been better The staff is truly very friendly, kind and very helpful. a truly good hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Will be a showpiece - when the teething problems are fixed”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: Previous reviewers have commented on the degree to which this new hotel has opened without really having everything checked and working - and our experience was no different. It should be a flagship for Holiday Inn Express - an elegant bank building that has been sensitively refurbished with a particularly large and elegant lobby space. It also has a first rate staff team. The neighbourhood is 'up and coming', which means that it has a slightly edgy feel, but it is close enough to the Inner Harbor - about five blocks - to be confident that improvement will continue. Besides, it is only about one block from a major police post and patrol cars are constantly in evidence. However, what we Brits call the "snagging" process at the end of a big construction job has plainly not been done satisfactorily, if at all. Our room had a chipped bath, a badly scratched side panel on the bath, a loose faucet over the bathroom sink (tap over the basin), power circuit that did not function and rendered two lights inactive, and a loose leg on the studio chair. We were staying over a weekend so it was not unreasonable that some of these could not be fixed by maintenance, but they do raise issues both about building management and construction quality. If a plumber got away with fitting a chipped bath, or dropping a wrench into it and not replacing it, what does this say about construction standards - and what other problems are lurking? The front desk were charming and thanked us for our courteous reports - if we didn't tell them about problems, they couldn't be fixed. Well, there are consultants in the hotel business who do that sort of pre-occupancy checking - and I don't think they would miss a chipped bath. Is it really fair to expect customers to do that checking for you? Is it really appropriate to charge them quite a full rate for being the test-drivers? I do think this is a hotel with a good future - but I would track its reviews quite carefully to be sure that the problems reported by this, and other early reviewers, do actually get fixed. By the way, if you are there on a weekend, there is a really good farmer's market on Sunday morning just one block down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't have opened until they'd ironed out the kinks.”
Reviews.Author: ellalily
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel as it was literally across the road from the venue I was attending, which was my whole reason for being in Baltimore. It's a lovely building, and the room was of excellent quality. There were a few missing items; no general information about Baltimore, and no Guest Directory, but as I knew this was a relatively new hotel, I overlooked this omissions. What I can't overlook is what happened when I tried to do a load of laundry before I left. Unbeknownst to me, the guest laundry was not operational. As there was no indication AT ALL that this was the case (not even a simple "OUT OF ORDER" sign on the machines or door), I loaded the (apparently working) washing machine with my laundry and detergent, but could not start the machine. A call to the front desk confirmed that it wasn't working. This knowledge would have been helpful before I'd soaked my dirty laundry with detergent. As I had 90 minutes before I had to leave to get a bus to Philadelphia, I accepted the offer for housekeeping to do my laundry for me. Ninety long minutes later, I still didn't have my laundry back, and I had 20 minutes to get to the other side of Baltimore to catch my bus. Eventually after practically begging for my clothes back, they were returned (still wet) and despite the best efforts of the young man driving the hotel shuttle, I did indeed miss my bus and had to forfeit my prepaid fare, then fork out $70 for a train ticket in order to get to Philadelphia in time for a pre-arranged engagement. To say I was upset and disappointed is an understatement. If I was in Baltimore in a year's time and needed to stay close to the same venue, I'd consider it, but would probably stay elsewhere and fork out for the cab ride instead. Particularly as they charged me for the shuttle because a cab would have taken even longer to get there.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Baltimore-Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 221 North Gay Street, Baltimore, MD 21202
